content: Electron is an open-source framework developed by GitHub, used for building cross-platform desktop applications using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It combines the Chromium rendering engine, Node.js runtime, and native GUI components to create desktop apps that can run on Windows, macOS, and Linux systems. Electron enables developers to build applications with web technologies and package them as standalone desktop applications, providing native capabilities and access to system APIs. It has gained popularity and is used by various companies and developers for building desktop applications.
